gurmukhi: lXwieE huqy cplw sI gdw sr eyk hI isaU kwt deI hY ]S`qR ky mwrin kI blBdiH mwnhu Aws dutUk BeI hY ]1851]
transliteration: Lyaaeo Houte Chaplaa Sigadaa Sar Ek Hisio Sooo Kaat Daihai|| Dhattr(u) Ke Maaran(i) Kibalbhadrah(i) Maanoh Aas Doutook Bhaihai||1851||
translation: He intercepted the mace coming like lightning and in this way, the hope of Balram for killing the enemy was shattered.1851.

gurmukhi: kwt gdw jb AYsy deI qbhI bl Fwl kiRpwn sMBwr ]Dwie clXo Air mwrin kwrin SMk kCU icq mY n ibcwrI ]
transliteration: Kaat Gadaa Jah Aise Daitab-hibal Dhaal Krpaan Sanbhdaree|| Dhaae Chadyo Ar(i) Maaran(i) Kaaran(i) Shank Kachhodh Chit Mai Na Bichdaree||
translation: When the king intercepted the mace, then Balram took up his sword and shield; he marched forward to kill the enemy fearlessly;

gurmukhi: BUp inhwr kY Awvq ko grjXo brKw kir bwnin BwrI ]Fwl deI sq Dw kir kY kr kI krvwr qiRDw kir fwrI ]1852]
transliteration: Bhoop Nihaar Kai Aavat Ko Gadjyo Barkhaa Kar(i) Baanan(i) Bhdaree|| Dhaal Daisat Dhaa Kar(i) Kai Kar Kikarvaar Tridhaa Kar(i) Ddaree||1852||
translation: The king seeing him coming showered his arrows and thundered; he cut the shield of Balram into one hundred parts and the sword into three parts.1852.

gurmukhi: Fwl ktI qrvwr geI kit AYsy hlw XuD sXwm inhwrXo ]mwrq hY bl ko Ab hI niRp XoN Apny mn mwiJ ibcwrXo ]
transliteration: Dhaal Katitarvaar Gadkattee Aise Halaa Yudh Syaam Nihaarryo|| Maarat Hai Bal Ko Ab Hinrip Yon Apne Man Maajh(i) Bichdaryo||
translation: Krishna saw Balram with his broken shield and sword and on this side, the king Jarasandh thought of killing him at the same instant;

gurmukhi: ckR sMBwr murwr qbY kr ju`D ky hyq clXo bl DwrXo ]ry niRp qU iBr mo sMg Awie kY rwm BnY iem sXwm pukwrXo ]1853]
transliteration: Chakra Sanbhaar Muraar Tabai Kar Juddh Ke Het Chadyo Bal Dhdaryo|| Re Nrip Too Bihir Mo San Aae Kai Raam Bhanai Im Syaam Poukdaryo||1853||
translation: Then Krishna moved forward for fighting, holding his discus; according to the poet Ram, he began to challenge the king for fighting.1853.

gurmukhi: XoN bqIXw rn mY suin BUpiq jUJ mcwvn sXwm isau AwXo ]rois bFwie Gno icq mY kr kybr so Dnu qwn cFwXo ]
transliteration: Yon Bateeyaa Ran Mai Soun(i) Bhoopat(i) Joojh Machaavadsyaam Sio Aayo|| Ros(i) Badhaae Ghano Chit Mai Kar Kebar So Dhan(u) Taan Chadhaayo||
translation: Hearing the challenge of Krishna, the king marched forward for waging war; he got enraged and fitted his arrow in his bow;

gurmukhi: dIrG kauc sjy qn mY kib ky mn my jsu ieau aupjwXo ]mwnhu ju`D smY irs kY rGunwQ ky aUpr rwvn AwXo ]1854]
transliteration: Deeragh Kaouch Saje Tan Mai Kabi Ke Man Me Jas(u) Io Oupjaayo|| Maanoh Juddh Samai Ris Kai Raghounaath Ke Oopar Raavan Aayo||1854||
translation: Because of the thick armour on his body, the king Jarasandh appeared like Ravana falling on Ram, being highly enraged in the war.1854.

gurmukhi: Awvq BXo niRp sXwm ky swmuih qau Dn sRI biRjnwQ sMBwrXo ]Dwvq BXo ieq qy hir swmuih qRws kCU icq mY n ibcwrXo ]
transliteration: Oovat Bhyo Nrip Syaam Ke Saamuh(i) Tau Dhan Sribrijnaath Sanbhdaryo|| Dhaavat Bhyo It Te Har(i) Saamuh(i) Traas Kachhodh Chit Mai Na Bichdaryo||
translation: Seeing the king coming in front of him, Krishna held up his bow and came before the king fearlessly;

gurmukhi: kwn pRmwn lau qwn kmwn su bwn ly S`qR pY mwrXo ]KMf huie KMf igrXo iCq mY mno cMd ko rwhu ny mwr ibdwrXo ]1855]
transliteration: Kaan Pramaan Lau Taan Kamaan Su Baan Le Shattra Pai Mdaryo|| Khanndhue Khanndgiryo Chhit Mai Mano Channd Ko Raahu Ne Maar Biddaryo||1855||
translation: Pulling the bow upto his ear, he shot his arrow on the canopy of the enemy and in an instant, the canopy fell down and broke into bits; it seemed that Rahu had broken the moon into fragments.1855.
